topic.title: how to preserve something we don't own
topic.body:
If I'm surfing the web and find an article which I'd love not to vanish away... how could I preserve It?
I mean, i could keep a copy on my HDD or post it as a blog post on 0N!
But if I post It, I suppose, It is considered like "stealing"!

so.. I should post on a blog in the form of a "personal thought" and preserve the "important part" of the article!

or am I missing something? (not articles under a Creative Common protection)

topic.title: 1 file missing: content.json in cloned, signed and published blog
topic.body:
I'm creating a blog via ZeroNet only, I cloned the ZeroBlog one and applied my materials..
But once singned (successfully) and published It gives me this message: 
>"No peers found, but your content is ready to access."

Okay, nobody can have It because I published It now but when updating It tells me that
>"1 file update failed"

and It is the **content.json**

how to solve this problem? I'm stuck :/
the blog is this one [Link to the blog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/14sYamG8agjTLeW8DfwTKbYRmTwaPbs4au)

topic.title: ZeroID protection
topic.body:
As far as I know,
if someone copies our "users.json" file, they could impersonalize ourself,
any way to prevent this from happening?

Something like restricted permissions maybe? like: copy forbidden at least you insert a passcode!

topic.title: new mention!
topic.body: An E-mail or something similar (it could be a website/application)  for posts in which I am mentioned, just to keep track! =)

topic.title: zeroID: does It store dynamic info?
topic.body: When having conversations, mails, new sites, etc... on the ZN, does the file "users.json" get updates or is It static? _(so I can backup It today for a tomorrow)_

topic.title: Internet Day (Italy)
topic.body:
In Italy is today the **"Internet Day": 30 years of internet** but the digital divide is still very high..
- In big cities up to 40-50MB/s
- out of the center up to 0.80 MB/s

Happy Internet Day, Italy :')

topic.title: Internet is not for everyone but It should!
topic.body:
Shouldn't Internet be _freely available_ for everyone?
I mean, maybe It's an idea of mine but in this era, not having an internet access is very debilitating.. an many have not! Or at least, cannot pay for having it..
[my experience with this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GrwWFTmrKgUGQsGxrKSsRbb2dt8UJaBPN/?Post:9:Back+offline!)

topic.title: Taxes on technology usage
topic.body:
Do you have taxes for any kind of technology usage in your country?
I mean.. in Italy there are taxes almost for everything.. here some:

- Electricity: +20%
- TV aerial jack/radio (internet is considered TV): ~€100/year
- 1 Mobile phone number: private: €5,16/month | Commercial: €12,91
- Hard/SolidState drives: 10%
- optical recording supports: €0,23/h [yes, valued hours]
- mobile phone SSD capacity: €0,50/GB
- books: 4%
- ebooks: 22%
- a plan to tax €0,50 for every internet GB used (revoked)
- and many many many more taxes of this kind....

The main reason beyond many of this taxes is a "legal" but monopolistic society in the country that pretend to respect authors' right but authors must pay them to execute things they created.. I have friends that pay so much because they want to play their music, video or whatelse in public. Even if freely. It's name is SIAE.
When going in commercial, well.. take a look to the phone number list item, many many more taxes... many! People in Italy fires employees to pay these..

Do You have these kind of taxes on your states too?

topic.title: feature idea: ZN Kickstarter
topic.body:
what about a sort of a ZeroNet KickStarter program?
Obviously, It won't be something about payments but about valuable projects to seed :)

I explain: in KickSTarter people donate money to make a project real..
My idea is a p2p site where people can decide to seed that specific website because revolutionary.. or maybe could offert Its help to improve it!
Something like [ZeroProxies](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroProxies.bit), [Play](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp/), [PedoBlocker Wiki](http://127.0.0.1:43110/15dfgcBhYM8Nkn7miAoetavifmJryUfCqv/), [ZeroLeakZ](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/), [Games Nintendo](http://127.0.0.1:43110/19za8TViGJF4xdvkQHLXK2UCb2gLC1nSVT/)...
There are many good project out there!

My idea is a "kickstarting like" website where these sites can be enhanced in order to increase the numbers of seeder :)

Maybe with a reddit like system that ups the most charismatic projects :)

topic.title: 0Nita, per unire gli italiani sperduti :)
topic.body:
Oggi nasce [0Nita](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BrdUYNAbRt4P2Jxpgk5WhtKR2oLicBgcw) un progetto che si propone di avvicinare i pochi siti italiani presenti qui sulla ZeroNet!

topic.title: multiple sessions, how to?
topic.body:
Any idea on how to open more than a session simultaneously? With i.e. 2 accounts logged in.

I thought about a virtual machine running a second O.S. but my idea is use both the sessions on the same **linux** O.S.  :)

topic.title: News zites - anyone?
topic.body:
By [cruze](http://localhost:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Profile/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/17BVAjD2Rk6BxdcMc3LjYKgF8aAWbwVuRj/cruze@zeroid.bit) 's [post](http://localhost:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/17BVAjD2Rk6BxdcMc3LjYKgF8aAWbwVuRj/1483274882): We need more news channels.

I actually know these:
[River of News from BBC](http://localhost:43110/newsriver.bit)
[P2P news flow](http://localhost/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topics:1_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG/P2P+news+flow)
and not daily:
[The news gateway](http://localhost:43110/15ThY8kpAbjidWNfXHeyDT48noj6ArYjmz)
[The Blockchain News](http://localhost:43110/bcnews.bit)

any other?

and what about some sort of **creative commons** feed of news by various journals? :) or directly a zite with all of these ^_^

topic.title: Russia's own Internet
topic.body:
Did You know about the Russia's project to build their own internet from 1st August 2018?
I link to You the clearnet article I found:
 [Why Russia is Building Its Own Internet](https://spectrum.ieee.org/tech-talk/telecom/internet/could-russia-really-build-its-own-alternate-internet)

IMO, decentralized networks are definitelly the way to go!! Expecially after this! ^^

topic.title: Wikipedia obscured in Italy for 5th July.
topic.body:
Wikipedia Italia decided to self-obscure because of the European's articles 11 and 13.

Here the translation of the thing:

Dear reader,

On 5 July 2018, the European Parliament will decide whether to speed up the approval of the copyright directive. This directive, if promulgated, will significantly limit the freedom of the Internet.

Instead of updating the copyright laws in Europe to promote everyone's participation in the information society, it threatens online freedom and creates obstacles to accessing the Net by imposing new barriers, filters, and restrictions. If the proposal is approved, it may be impossible to share a newspaper article on social networks or find it on a search engine. Wikipedia itself could risk closing.

The proposal has already met with the firm disapproval of over 70 computer scientists, including web creator Tim Berners-Lee, 169 academics, 145 organizations working in the fields of human rights, freedom of the press, scientific research and the computer industry and the Wikimedia Foundation.

For these reasons, the Italian Wikipedia community has decided to obscure all encyclopedia pages. We want to continue to offer a free, open, collaborative encyclopedia with verifiable content. We therefore ask all Members of the European Parliament to reject the current text of the directive and to reopen the debate by examining the many proposals of the Wikimedia associations, starting with the abolition of Articles 11 and 13, as well as the extension of the freedom of panorama to the whole EU and the protection of the public domain.

The Italian community of Wikipedia.

https://it.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Comunicato_3_luglio_2018

topic.title: ZeroNet indexed on the clearnet
topic.body:
Wouldn't be cool having ZeroNet indexed also by clearnet's search engines?
It would increase the service population... obviously it should pass through a proxy.

What are your thoughts about?
@nofish , have you thought at this yet / is planned ?

topic.title: Is media on ZeroNet sliced for transfer?
topic.body:
In these years I always gave for true that bin media (images, videos, ...) are downloaded from a peer only and no slice takes place...

Am I correctly understanding the ways the thing works?

i.e. in GIF Time, am I downloading the 10 GIF on the page from 10 peers or from many more?

topic.title: What do you think of Dr. Craig Wright claiming to be Satoshi Nakamoto?
topic.body:
Dr. Craig Wright [claims to be Satoshi Nakamoto](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5DCAC1j2HTY) What do you think about? Do you believe it?
He assigneg a message with the public key associated with the first transaction.. could it have been hacked? Or the real Satoshi been threatened/blackmailed or killed so to release the key?

What are your thoughts about?

topic.title: Censorship: New Zealand mosques attack on Christchurch
topic.body:
We are fighting against censorship and for decentralization. This is a great example on the subject.

Do you think the video should or should not be censored? Actually there's no full video that I've been able to retrieve, everything is censored or cut as asked from the Country.

topic.title: Misleading? New Zealand mosques attack on Christchurch
topic.body:
I was actually discussing this thing with a person face to face and I report what we concluded... It could also have been something studied in order to concentrate on this instead of the Climate Day... Young students manifested for the climate change but at the same time such a tragedy happened... And some of the info given on the news are difficult to believe watching at the video... 
"Early reports in the news wrongly suggest that there were multiple gunmen, but there was in fact only one shooter."

So in the end... could be that He (or family) has been paid for doing that? Or the time chosen so precise?

The climate change should unify the planed, this instead divide it.
